an4.170:2.1: Note that in BB’s transl. he puts byakaroti in past tense, which creates confusion: did they declare in four ways or attain in four ways? Also, I have rationalized the final phrase. The four paths are mutually exclusive, so it doesn’t make sense to say “by four paths or one of them”. It must be an idiomatic phrase.
an4.170:6.1: Both the Tika and Pts support BB’s acceptance of mānasam as the reading here. The Chinese however doesn’t, having just 掉亂所持 (=uddhaccaviggahita).
